Articles.Title: Microsoft Updates Azure Mobile Apps, Ponders Future
Articles.Description: Microsoft recently released a new version of Azure Mobile Apps, which allows developers, including those on Xamarin, to have cloud-based back-ends for data storage, online/offline synch, authentication and more. It also now supports Xamarin.Essentials for authentication, winner! The team have released a survey to help direct and potentially save the future of this service so its well worth taking a few minutes if you use it with your apps! [**Microsoft Updates Azure Mobile Apps, Ponders Future **](https://visualstudiomagazine.com/articles/2020/12/04/azure-mobile-apps.aspx)

Articles.Title: 10 Places To Search for Design Inspiration
Articles.Description: We love pretty UI's in our mobile apps and so finding design inspiration can really help us in making beautiful apps. This list of 10 places you can find some is really useful and includes some classics like Behance and Dribble.

Articles.Title: Users can customize iOS App Icons after downloading their Xamarin app
Articles.Description: Ever seen an iOS app where it lets you customise the app icon after install? Well you can make that happen in Xamarin too!
Articles.Author: Saamer Mansoor

Articles.Title: Animate A Mic Drop With Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Sometimes we watch amazing talks or read amazing blogs and just think to ourselves 'oooo mic drop!'..so isn't is great to be able to add a super sweet animation into your app that shows just that?!
Articles.Author: Khalid Abuhakmeh

Articles.Title: Replicating Bill Details UI in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Another great entry in the recreating Dribble UI trend, from Leomaris Reyes. This week, it's a Bill Details UI.  This kind of UI is common for many scenarios so its great to learn how to make it look great too!
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Meet the RadPopUp Control for Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Sometimes we have to present certain important information on our application in order to be able to alert the user in a fast, precise, concise way of demanding all their attention, with a goal of a quick reaction and effective understanding of the information. This information can be presented if the user performs a specific action. Letâ€™s look at an sample scenario!

Articles.Title: 5 Must Install NuGets for New Xamarin Projects
Articles.Description: Not 1 but 5!! Xamarin comes with some amazing features out of the box in it's own NuGet packages, but also with the included Xamarin.Essentials package for Forms projects, allowing you to access loads of native features from your shared code. But there are some amazing packages on top of that which can be great extras, I certainly install a few of these from James' list everytime I hit File -> New!
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Null Pointers 30: Mobile Payment
Articles.Description: In this episode, we discuss mobile payment. Since COVID-19 has made contactless payment the preferred standard, so has mobile payment been used by more and more people.
Articles.Author: Null Pointers

Articles.Title: Zoom, Point, Outline, & Magnify The Screen During Presentations & Coding on Windows
Articles.Description: Although not Xamarin specific, this video from James is super useful for anyone making presentations or doing demo's on Windows.  I know a lot of the community, including a lot of our wonderful contributors, are also public speakers so this video is definitely handy!
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: The Xamarin Podcast Episode 83: Wrapping up 2020 by looking ahead to 2021!
Articles.Description: It's the end of the year and in December's podcast James and Matt wrap up 2020 by talking about a cool new app that lets you draw 360 degree sketches with the Surface Duo - made with Xamarin.Forms! Azure Mobile Apps v4.2 is official, there's a brand new Microsoft Q&A site. And you don't want to miss a sneak preview of what's to come with .NET MAUI! [**https://www.xamarinpodcast.com/83**](https://www.xamarinpodcast.com/83)
